00042 template<class T>
00043 class UnlabeledValueArg : public ValueArg<T>
00044 {
00045 
00046   // If compiler has two stage name lookup (as gcc >= 3.4 does)
00047   // this is requried to prevent undef. symbols
00048   using ValueArg<T>::_ignoreable;
00049   using ValueArg<T>::_hasBlanks;
00050   using ValueArg<T>::_extractValue;
00051   using ValueArg<T>::_typeDesc;
00052   using ValueArg<T>::_name;
00053   using ValueArg<T>::_description;
00054   using ValueArg<T>::_alreadySet;
00055   using ValueArg<T>::toString;
00056

00082                      bool req,

00212 template<class T>
00213 UnlabeledValueArg<T>::UnlabeledValueArg(const std::string& name, 
00214                                         const std::string& desc, 
00215                                         bool req,
00216                                         T val,
00217                                         const std::string& typeDesc,
00218                                         bool ignoreable,
00219                                         Visitor* v)
00220   : ValueArg<T>("", name, desc, req, val, typeDesc, v)
00221 { 
00222   _ignoreable = ignoreable;
00223 
00224   OptionalUnlabeledTracker::check(req, toString());
00225 
00226 }

00231                                         bool req,
00232                                         T val,
00233                                         const std::string& typeDesc,
00234                                         CmdLineInterface& parser,

00238 { 
00239   _ignoreable = ignoreable;

00276 
00280 template<class T>
00281 bool UnlabeledValueArg<T>::processArg(int *i, std::vector<std::string>& args) 
00282 {
00283   
00284   if ( _alreadySet )
00285     return false;
00286   
00287   if ( _hasBlanks( args[*i] ) )
00288     return false;
00289 
00290   // WEL: Do no allow unlabeld args that start with "-". If they are
00291   // allowed, then the parser cannot detect invalid options!
00292 
00293   if ( _ignoreable && Arg::ignoreRest() )
00294     return false;
00295 
00296   if (args[*i].find_first_of( Arg::flagStartString() ) == 0)
00297     return false;
00298 
00299   // never ignore an unlabeled arg
00300   // WEL: except for those that start with a "-"
00301   
00302   _extractValue( args[*i] );
00303   _alreadySet = true;
00304   return true;
00305 }
00306 
00310 template<class T>
00311 std::string UnlabeledValueArg<T>::shortID(const std::string& val) const
00312 {
00313   std::string id = "<" + _typeDesc + ">";
00314 
00315   return id;
00316 }
00317 
00321 template<class T>
00322 std::string UnlabeledValueArg<T>::longID(const std::string& val) const
00323 {
00324   // Ideally we would like to be able to use RTTI to return the name
00325   // of the type required for this argument.  However, g++ at least, 
00326   // doesn't appear to return terribly useful "names" of the types.  
00327   std::string id = "<" + _typeDesc + ">";
00328 
00329   return id;  
00330 }
00331 
00335 template<class T>
00336 bool UnlabeledValueArg<T>::operator==(const Arg& a ) const
00337 {
00338   if ( _name == a.getName() || _description == a.getDescription() )
00339     return true;
00340   else
00341     return false;
00342 }
00343 
00344 template<class T>
00345 void UnlabeledValueArg<T>::addToList( std::list<Arg*>& argList ) const
00346 {
00347   argList.push_back( const_cast<Arg*>(static_cast<const Arg* const>(this)) );
00348 }

00350 }
